basics.name: Ashish Kushwaha
basics.title: DevOps / Software Developer Engineer
basics.summery: A passionate and self-driven Software Developer and Computer Science dual-degree (B.Tech + M.Tech) student with an 8.5 CGPA, I bring a robust background in full-stack web development, specializing in efficient, scalable, and user-focused applications using modern JavaScript frameworks (React, Svelte), Tailwind CSS, and Chrome Extension APIs. I've led end-to-end product development, notably HireLift—an AI-driven Chrome extension.

education.degree: B. Tech + M. Tech CSE in Software Engineering

experience.title: Software Development Engineer
experience.description: Contributed to core product development, starting with React.js static pages and advancing to building a Chrome extension with Manifest V3. Integrated Claude API with AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, and S3 for scalable AI features. Deployed MVP with a dashboard to track user activity and internal operations.

experience.title: Internship Trainee
experience.description: Completed intensive AI training focused on real-world applications of Artificial Intelligence and Data Science. Worked on practical AI projects involving machine learning, classification, and predictive modeling. Conducted ETL, EDA, and built dashboards using Power BI and Excel.

experience.title: Web Developer Intern
experience.description: Designed and developed a job applicant tracking frontend using the MERN stack. Worked with the Registrar’s Office to gather requirements and deliver feature-driven updates that streamlined university hiring.

projects.name: 0xPortfolio
projects.summary: Personal portfolio showcasing professional journey, skills, and a curated collection of projects and experiences.
details: Built as a centralized portfolio to present projects, skills, and achievements in a structured way for recruiters and collaborators.
Implements a modern web UI to highlight key work with clear navigation and sections tailored for a software developer profile.

projects.name: 0xResume
projects.summary: Automated resume build system that dynamically updates and syncs across cloud environments.
details: Uses LaTeX and automation workflows to generate resumes from a single source of truth, reducing manual edits.
Designed to sync and update resumes reliably across environments, enabling consistent profile updates for different use cases.

projects.name: OpenAI_SDK_Research_Assistant
projects.summary: Research assistant that uses the OpenAI SDK to automate web research, generate reports, and compare them with existing documents.

Supports document comparison to highlight differences and similarities between new research outputs and existing material.

projects.name: SupportAI-Voice
projects.summary: Voice-enabled RAG system that lets users query their PDFs using speech through an OpenAI SDK and Streamlit-based interface.
details: Enables users to upload PDF documents and ask voice-based questions, returning context-aware answers from the content.
Demonstrates a Retrieval-Augmented Generation pipeline integrating audio input, document retrieval, and LLM responses.

projects.name: ContextPDF
projects.summary: Multi-PDF chatbot that allows users to upload several PDFs and chat with them using context-aware question answering.
details: Implements PDF ingestion and context retrieval to power conversational queries over multiple documents.
Provides a chat interface tailored to explore, summarize, and clarify information contained across PDFs.

projects.name: ProxyMe-
projects.summary: Mini AI agent that acts as a proxy version of the author and responds to queries on their behalf.
details: Designed to answer questions as if they were coming from the author, based on predefined logic and data.
Explores the idea of personal AI agents tailored to an individual's preferences and information.

projects.name: 0xBlogs
projects.summary: Technical blog site documenting learnings and insights in software, Linux, and cloud development.
details: Organizes technical articles focused on efficient software engineering, Linux workflows, and cloud tooling.
Uses a static-site setup to publish posts with minimal overhead and fast load times.

projects.name: Devops-automation
projects.summary: DevOps-focused automation utilities implemented in C++.

Targets improved reliability and reduced manual intervention in development and deployment workflows.

projects.name: dotfiles

projects.name: Huegen
projects.summary: Fast C++ wallpaper color extractor and theming engine using K-means and perceptual color analysis.

projects.name: LoomFox

projects.name: Learning

projects.name: Sticky-Paper

projects.name: Hackfed-org

certificates.title: Introduction to Oracle Cloud Essentials
certificates.summery: Gained foundational understanding of cloud computing through Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. Learned to provision and manage compute instances, object storage, and networking components. Demonstrated knowledge of IAM, compartments, and cost management within OCI.

Gained hands-on experience with command-line tools and system administration tasks in a Linux environment.

certificates.title: CVR 2025 Research Paper Presentation Certificate

certificates.summery: Authored and published a research paper focused on optimizing CPU instruction issue (CPII) frequency scaling to enhance energy efficiency and performance in modern processors. The paper presents analytical models and experimental results demonstrating dynamic scaling strategies for reducing power consumption while maintaining processing throughput.

certificationsAchievements: Published research paper titled “Adaptive Task-Based CPU Scaling for Efficient Power Allocation in Edge Computing.”
Introduction to Linux (LFS101) covering core Linux system and various command-line fundamentals by The Linux Foundation.

Winner of multiple hackathons, like Bhabha Bandhu by Microsoft, Glitch pan-India Hackathon on open source development.
